content: this may be an option to consider leg join your colour 2 and start working the leg following chart a for the first 5 rounds 12 repeats around the leg 6 repeats per needle after round 5 break colour 1 and introduce colour 3 after round 10 break colour 2 and join colour 4 and so on it can be more effective if you do not repeat your colour sequence strictly but with a slight variation obviously if you decide to work the pattern in only 2 colours you do not break the yarn and join new colours you will just knit the whole sock with your chosen colours work the leg for as long as you desire it will look best if you work the heel in the colour that you have introduced last 5 rounds before starting the heel heel work the heel over the 36 sts on needle 2 after finishing the last round by turning and starting with a purl row row1 sl1 p to end turn row2 sl1 k1 to end turn work the heel flap for as long as you need it to be this depends on the height of your instep i did a total of 39 row for a size 42 but feel free to adapt this to your individual needs make a note of how many row you did however having completed a ws row turn the heel as follows row1 sl1 work in the established pattern for 20 sts ssk k1 turn leaving 12 sts unworked row2 sl1 p7 p2tog p1 turn again leaving 12 sts unworked row3 sl1 k to 1 st before gap ssk k1 turn row4 sl1 p to 1 st before gap p2tog p1 turn repeat row 3 and 4 until you have used up all the sts either side you should be ready to work a k row with 22 sts on your needle gander page 3 gusset using needle2 k11 this is the centre back join the next colour in your sequence and starting with this colour work 11 sts according to chart b with needle1 pick up and knit 1 st in each slipped stitch down the side of the heel flap still alternating between your colours you will pick up half the number of row you knitted for my 39 row i picked up 20 sts m1 in the gap before your instep sts work across the instep sts according to chart a 3 repeats on needle 1 then 3 repeats on needle 2 m1 in the gap before the heel flap using the opposite colour to the one you used on the other side pick up and knit 1 st in each slipped st up the other side of the heel flap again alternating the co- lours according to chart b make sure you have picked up the same number of sts as before work the 11 sts to the centre back in chart b chart b is
